properties.description: Form History -------------- Modified 22-June-2016 - Added "Undergraduate Student Symposium" to the relationTab options. Modified 17-June-2016 - Added "Parker Natural History Museum" to the relationTab options. Modified 23-June-2015 to add blank roleText entries and default the Org and Event roleText fields to blank. Created on 06-May-2015 from "DG Full MODS - Production Ready - April 29, 2015"

Enter the object title. Please use appropriate Title Case.
/mods/titleInfo/title -> /dc/title
properties.title: Title

properties.description:
Enter alternative titles for the object.
/mods/titleInfo[@type="alternative"]/title -> /dc/title[alternative: %value%]
properties.title: Alternative Title(s)

properties.description:
Choose the basic content type from the standard MODS list provided. Descriptions of standard types can be found at http://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/typeofresource.html.
/mods/typeOfResource -> /dc/type
properties.title: Type

properties.description:
Select a more specific content type (genre) from the list provided.
/mods/genre-> /dc/type[Genre: %value%]
properties.title: Genre

properties.description:
Please use this space to write a concise abstract of the work.
/mods/abstract -> /dc/description
properties.title: Abstract

properties.description:
The resource's Table of Contents.
/mods/tableOfContents -> /dc/description
properties.title: Table of Contents

properties.description:
Use this fieldset to enter Personal and/or Family names ONLY. Other fieldsets are provided for Corporate and Event names below.
/mods/name[@type="personal" or @type="family"]/role/roleTerm[text()='%role%'] --> /dc/contributor[%value% (%role%)]
If %role% is 'Author' (creator) then --> /dc/creator[%value%]
Select from the provided list the type of name to be recorded.
properties.title: Type

properties.description: Select the role of this contributor from the list provided. Note that selecting the default of 'Author' will distinguish the contributor as a 'creator' of the resource. Contact the System Admin for assistance adding new roles to the selection list.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: Enter an optional displayLabel here to override the "Role" label in the MODS metadata display.
properties.title: Name displayLabel (Optional)

properties.description: Enter the full, authorized personal or family name of this contributor by typing a few characters from the name and selecting from the list provided. If a suitable match is not available enter the full text.
properties.title: Name

properties.description: Use this fieldset to enter Corporate or Organization names ONLY.
properties.title: Organization Author(s) and Contributor(s)

properties.description: /mods/name[@type="corporate"]/role/roleTerm[text()='%role%'] --> /dc/contributor[%value% (%role%)]
Select the role of this contributor from the list provided. Contact the System Admin for assistance adding new roles to the selection list.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: Enter an optional displayLabel here to override the "Role" label in the MODS metadata display.
properties.title: Name displayLabel (Optional)

properties.description: Enter the full, authorized organization name of this contributor by typing a few characters from the name and selecting from the list provided. If a suitable match is not available please enter the full text.
properties.title: Name

properties.description: Use this fieldset to enter Event names ONLY.
properties.title: Event Author(s) and Contributor(s)

properties.description: /mods/name[@type="conference"]/[role/roleTerm[text()='%role%'] --> /dc/contributor[%value% (%role%)]
Select the role of this contributor from the list provided. Contact the System Admin for assistance adding new roles to the selection list.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: Enter an optional displayLabel here to override the "Role" label in the MODS metadata display.
properties.title: Name displayLabel (Optional)

properties.description: Enter the full, authorized conference or event name of this contributor by typing a few characters from the name and selecting from the list provided. If a suitable match is not available enter the full text.
properties.title: Name

properties.description:
Use the tabs above to enter PUBLIC notes that may be visible to patrons and may be harvested from the repository. Additional notes can be added by opening new tabs. Refer to http://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/mods-notes.html#source and http://oclc.org/bibformats/en/5xx.html for guidance.
/mods/note[@type='%type%'] --> /dc:note.
properties.title: Public Notes

properties.description: Select the type of note to be recorded. Types which are specific to Grinnell are listed first and labeled in UPPERCASE. Standard MODS types are listed below the Grinnell values and are in lowercase.
properties.title: Type

properties.description: Enter an optional displayLabel here to override the note "Type" label in the MODS metadata display.
properties.title: Note displayLabel (Optional)

properties.description:
Use the tabs above to enter PRIVATE (admin) notes that will NOT be visible to patrons and cannot be harvested from the repository. Additional notes can be added by opening new tabs.
/mods/relatedItem[@type='admin']/note[@type='%type%'] --> NO translation to DC.
properties.title: Private (Admin) Notes

properties.description: Select the type of note to be recorded. Types which are specific to Grinnell are listed first and labeled in UPPERCASE. Standard MODS types are listed below the Grinnell values and are in lowercase.
properties.title: Type

properties.description:
Use the tabs above to enter IDENTIFIERS. Additional identifiers can be added by opening new tabs.
/mods/identifier[@type='%type%'].
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: Select the type of identifier to be recorded. All standard MODS identifier types are listed with the most popular types near the top of the list and Grinnell-specific values near the bottom. The standard list can be found at http://www.loc.gov/standards/sourcelist/standard-identifier.html.

options.ansi: American National Standards Institute (ANSI) and National Information Standards Organisation (NISO)
options.index: Global Trade Identification Number 14 (EAN/UCC-128 or ITF-14)
options.natgazfid: U.S. National Gazetteer Feature Name Identifier
options.nipo: Número de Identificación de las Publicaciones Oficiales (NIPO)
options.index: Publisher, distributor, or vendor stock number

properties.title: Type

properties.description: Enter an optional displayLabel here to override the default identifierType label in the MODS metadata display.
properties.title: Identifier displayLabel

properties.description: /mods/language/languageTerm[@type='code'] and [@type='text'].
properties.title: Language

properties.description: Enter a three letter iso639-2b language code from http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php as well as its equivalent language name. Additional language references can be added by opening new tabs.
/mods/dataCaptured.
properties.title: Accessioned

properties.description: /mods/dateValid.

Enter the creation date for this work in the form: YYYY-MM-DD. Required for faceted search to work properly.
/mods/dateCreated --> /dc/date
properties.title: Created

properties.description:
Enter the copyright dates. Note that each field should contain a single date. Multiple copyrights should be entered by adding additional tabs.
/mods/copyrightDate
properties.title: Copyright Date

properties.description: Enter copyright date.

Enter the date of issue or publication.
/mods/dateIssued --> /dc/date
properties.title: Issued

properties.description:
Enter edition numbers or dates. Note that each field should contain a single number or date. Multiple editions should be entered by adding additional tabs.
/mods/originInfo/edition --> dc?
properties.title: Edition(s)

properties.description:
Grinnell College is the default publisher. Multiple publishers should be entered by adding additional tabs.
/mods/originInfo/publisher --> dc?
properties.title: Publisher

properties.description:
Grinnell College is the default publisher. Change or add as needed.
/mods/publisher
Standard style is Chicago (16th Edition); use discipline specific style if desired
properties.title: Citations

properties.description: Describes the physical object.
properties.title: Physical Object Description

properties.description:
Enter the extent (dimension, number of pages, etc.) of the physical resource.
/mods/physicalDescription[@displayLabel="Physical"]/extent -> /dc/format[Physical Extent = %value%]
properties.title: Extent

properties.description: Enter an optional displayLabel here to override the default "Extent" label in the MODS metadata display.
properties.title: Extent displayLabel

properties.description:
A designation of the physical resource medium. Some examples include: Painting, Oil paint on canvas, Wood engraving, Etching, Lithograph.
/mods/physicalDescription[@displayLabel="Physical"]/form -> /dc/format[Physical Form = %value%]
properties.title: Form

properties.description: Describes the digital object.
properties.title: Digital Object Description

properties.description:
Enter the extent (number of pages, file size, recording length, etc.) of the digital resource.
/mods/physicalDescription[not(@displayLabel)]/extent -> /dc/format[Extent = %value%]
properties.title: Extent

properties.description: Enter an optional displayLabel here to override the default "Extent" label in the MODS metadata display.
properties.title: Extent displayLabel

properties.description:
Select the origin of the digital resource from the list provided.
/mods/physicalDescription/digitalOrigin --> /dc/format
properties.title: Digital Origin

properties.description:
Choose the MIME type for the file. To suggest additions to this list contact the System Admin.
/mods/physicalDescription/internetMediaType --> /dc/format
properties.title: MIME Type

properties.description: @TODO!
properties.title: Coverage (Lat/Long and Temporal)

properties.description: Add note: You may use http://www.latlong.net/ or another source. You may use DD form: 41.40338, 2.17403 DMS: 41°24'12.2"N 2°10'26.5"E , or DMM 41 24.2028, 2 10.4418 format
properties.title: Spatial (Latitude / Longitude)

properties.description: /mods/subject/cartographics/coordinates

Use for single or beginning date/time.
/mods/subject/temporal[@point="start"]
properties.title: From

properties.description:
Use for end date/time.
/mods/subject/temporal[@point="end"]
properties.title: To

properties.description:
Definition: a designation applied to a resource that indicates the subject by applying a formal system of coding and organizing resources according to subject areas. <p/>
Application: "classification" contains the classification number of a resource. It may also include the full call number if desired. This is equivalent to MARC fields 050-08X, subfields $a and $b.
properties.title: Classification

properties.description: /mods/classification[@authority="lcc"]
properties.title: Library of Congress

properties.description: This field produces a MODS element of the form: /mods/classification[@authority="lcc"].
properties.title: Classification (LCC)

properties.description:
Use this field for local classification using a mix of letters and numbers.
/mods/classification[@authority="local" and @type="mixed"]
properties.title: Mixed Local Call Number

properties.description: This field produces a MODS element of the form: /mods/classification[@authority="local" and @type="mixed"].
properties.title: Classification (DDC)

properties.description:
Use this field for local classification using numbers ONLY.
/mods/classification[@authority="local" and @type="numeric"]
properties.title: Numeric Local Call Number

properties.description:
Use this field for local classification using letters ONLY.
/mods/classification[@authority="local" and @type="alpha"]
properties.title: Alpha Local Call Number

properties.description: Subject(s) of the content. Type a few characters of your target subject title and choose from the autocomplete list. If a suitable match is not available, consider entering a subject title copied from http://id.loc.gov/authorities/subjects.html whenever possible.
properties.title: Subjects

properties.description:
Subject of the content per http://id.loc.gov/authorities/subjects.html.
/mods:subject[@authority="lcsh"]/mods:topic --> /dc.subject
properties.title: General Topics using Library of Congress Subject Heading (LCSH) Topics

properties.description:
Place(s) related to the content per LCSH.
/mods/subject[@authority="lcsh"]/geographic --> /dc/subject
properties.title: LCSH Place

properties.description:
Time period(s) related to the content per LCSH.
/mods/subject[@authority="lcsh"]/temporal[not(@point)] --> /dc/subject
properties.title: LCSH Chronological

properties.description:
Topics (keywords) which are explicitly NOT from the LCSH vocabulary.
/mods/subject[not(@authority)]/topic --> /dc/subject
properties.title: General NON-LCSH Topics (Keywords)

properties.description:
Use for genre of content such as the plot or theme (landscape; true crime stories; poetry ; menu; etc.) only if considered significant. Type a few characters of your target genre and choose from the autocomplete list. If no suitable match, consider entering a heading from an authoritative list such as http://www.loc.gov/catdir/cpso/genre_form_general_terms_hierarchies.pdf
/mods/subject[@usage="genre"]/topic
properties.title: Subject Genre

properties.description: Use for format of an object such as the materials or format (comic book ; acrylic ; poster ; website ; blog,; postcard; etc.) only if considered significant. Type a few characters of your target genre and choose from the autocomplete list. If no suitable match, consider entering a heading from an authoritative list such as http://www.loc.gov/catdir/cpso/genre_form_general_terms_hierarchies.pdf
properties.title: Subject Format

properties.description: Use for subject headings from non-LCSH thesauri such as AAT for Art & Architecture http://www.getty.edu/research/tools/vocabularies/aat/
properties.title: Subject Special

properties.description: Use for subject headings for the occupation of named persons who are the subject of the content, i.e., Drake, George A. could have the Occupation of ‘College Presidents’. Type a few characters of your target occupation and choose from the autocomplete list. If no suitable match, consider entering a heading from an authoritative list such as http://authorities.loc.gov/cgi-bin/Pwebrecon.cgi?DB=local&PAGE=First Subject Authority Headings.
properties.title: Subject Occupation

properties.description: Select a taxonomic rank and enter the resource's corresponding botanical classification.
properties.title: Taxonomic Classification

properties.description:
Refer to Wikipedia or other resources for explanations/discussions of various taxonomic schemes.

Contact digital@grinnell.edu to request changes or additions to the taxonomy presented in this form.
Select the taxonomic type (rank) of the corresponding classification (below).
properties.title: Rank

properties.description: Enter the name (value) of the specified type/rank.
properties.title: Classification

properties.description:
Select one related collection from the available list and open additional tabs to accomodate specifying more than one collection relationship. To suggest additions to this list contact the System Admin for assistance.
/mods/relatedItem/titleInfo/title --> /dc/relatedItem

options.index: Grinnell College. Parker Natural History Museum

index.key: Grinnell College. Special Collections and Archives

options.index: Grinnell College. Special Collections and Archives

properties.title: Collection Name or Title

properties.default_value: Copyright to this work is held by the author(s), in accordance with United States copyright law (USC 17). Readers of this work have certain rights as defined by the law, including but not limited to fair use (17 USC 107 et seq.).
properties.description: /mods/accessCondition[@type="useAndReproduction"] --> /dc/rights
properties.title: Copyright Information
